Package homework1

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • homework1.Account
  • public class Account
extends java.lang.Object
    Account class is used to create an account object and use in test classes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Account​(int accountId, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String birthdate, java.lang.String location)
      Constructor to create an account object.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addPost​(Post post)
      If the user is logged in, add the post to the array of posts
      void block​(Account account)
      If the user is logged in, then add the account to the blockedAccounts array

      If the user is logged in, then create a new Comment object and add it to the post's Comment array
      void followAccount​(Account account)
      This function checks if the user is logged in, and not blocked by the account they want to follow, and the account they want to follow is not themselves and not already in their following list.

        public void viewProfile​(Account account)

        Parameters:
        account - The account that the user wants to view.

      • addPost

        If the user is logged in, add the post to the array of posts
        Parameters:
        post - the post to be added

      • viewPosts

        public void viewPosts​(Account account)
        If the user is logged in, and not blocked by the account they want to view, and firstly viewed the profile of the account, prints the posts of the account that is given as a parameter
        Parameters:
        account - The account that the user wants to view.

      • followAccount

        public void followAccount​(Account account)
        This function checks if the user is logged in, and not blocked by the account they want to follow, and the account they want to follow is not themselves and not already in their following list. If all of these conditions are true, then adds the account to following list, and adds the user to the accounts followers list.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that the user wants to follow.

      • showFollowings

        public java.lang.String showFollowings​(Account account)
        Function to show the followings of the account.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that you want to show the followings of.
        Returns:
        A string of all the usernames of the accounts that the account is following.

      • showFollowers

        public java.lang.String showFollowers​(Account account)
        Function to show the followers of the account.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that you want to show the followers of.
        Returns:
        A string of all the usernames of the accounts that are following the account.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(Account account,
                        Message message)
        The function checks if the user is logged in, if the user is not blocked by the account, and if the user is following the account. If all of these conditions are met, the message is sent.
        Parameters:
        account - The account that the message is being sent to.
        message - The message that will be sent.

      • isFollowing

        public boolean isFollowing​(int id)
        This function checks if the account is following another account
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the account you want to check if you're following
        Returns:
        A boolean value.

        If the user is logged in, print out the number of messages in the inbox

        If the user is logged in, print out the number of messages in the outbox

        If the user is logged in, print out the inbox contents

        public void viewOutbox()
        If the user is logged in, print out the outbox contents

      • likePost

        public void likePost​(Post post,
                     int interactionId,
                     Account account)
        If the user is logged in, then create a new Like object and add it to the post's Like array
        Parameters:
        post - the post that the user wants to like
        interactionId - the id of the interaction, which is the same as the id of the like.
        account - the account of the post.

      • commentPost

        public void commentPost​(Post post,
                        int interactionId,
                        Account account,
                        java.lang.String content)
        If the user is logged in, then create a new Comment object and add it to the post's Comment array
        Parameters:
        post - the post that the user wants to comment on
        interactionId - the id of the interaction, which is the same as the id of the comment.
        account - the account of the post.
        content - the content of the comment

      • viewInteractions

        public void viewInteractions​(Account account)
        If the user is logged in and viwed the posts of the account, it prints out the interactions of the posts of the account that is passed as an argument.
        Parameters:
        account - The account whose posts interactions you want to view.

      • block

        public void block​(Account account)
        If the user is logged in, then add the account to the blockedAccounts array
        Parameters:
        account - The account that the user wants to block.

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked​(java.lang.String[] blockedAccounts)
        If the username of the current user is in the list of blocked accounts, return true, otherwise return false.
        Parameters:
        blockedAccounts - An array of strings that contains the usernames of the blocked accounts.
        Returns:
        A boolean value.
